source: ISO 14971:2019 + FDA General Surgical Device Guidance

hazards.description: Unintended damage to tissue adjacent to surgical site
hazards.harm: Perforation, laceration, necrosis of adjacent organs or structures
common_causes: Sharp edges or burrs on instrument
typical_controls: Atraumatic tip design with rounded edges
Sharpness testing and specifications
Visual inspection for burrs and defects
Instructions for proper surgical technique
Warnings about anatomical hazards
Surgeon training and credentialing requirements

hazards.description: Excessive or uncontrolled hemorrhage during or after surgery
hazards.harm: Hypovolemic shock, need for transfusion, reoperation, death
typical_controls: Vessel sealing validation testing (burst pressure, thermal spread)
Instructions for identification of vascular structures
Warnings about use in patients on anticoagulants
Backup hemostatic methods availability
Visual indicators for proper device activation
Clinical monitoring protocols for postoperative bleeding

hazards.description: Burn injury to tissue from heat-generating devices
hazards.harm: Full-thickness burns, organ perforation, fistula formation, chronic pain
typical_controls: Thermal testing per IEC 60601-2-2 (electrosurgical equipment)
Insulation integrity testing
Active electrode monitoring systems
Instructions for appropriate power settings by tissue type
Warnings about capacitive coupling risk
Visual/audible feedback during activation
Maximum activation time specifications

hazards.description: Unintended puncture of hollow viscus or organ
typical_controls: Optical or dilating trocar designs to reduce perforation risk
Insertion force testing and specifications
Instructions for use of Veress needle or Hasson technique
Warnings about anatomical landmarks
Visual confirmation before advancement
Surgeon training on entry techniques

hazards.description: Exposure to surgical smoke containing particulates and chemicals
hazards.harm: Respiratory irritation, potential carcinogenic exposure, vision obstruction
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Biological hazards - Infectious agents
common_causes: Tissue vaporization from electrosurgery or laser
typical_controls: Smoke evacuation system requirements in IFU
Warnings about plume hazards (particulates, chemicals, viruses)
Instructions for use with ULPA-filtered evacuation
Personal protective equipment recommendations (N95 masks)
Ventilation requirements for operating room

hazards.description: Patient or operator exposure to electrical current
hazards.harm: Ventricular fibrillation, cardiac arrest, burns, death
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1 compliance (leakage current limits, protective earth)
Type BF or CF applied part classification
IPX rating for liquid ingress protection (if applicable)
Dielectric strength testing
Instructions for pre-use inspection
Warnings about use with flammable anesthetics
Ground fault circuit interrupters (if applicable)

hazards.description: Cross-contamination between patients from reusable devices
hazards.harm: Surgical site infection, transmission of CJD, hepatitis, HIV
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Biological hazards - Infectious agents
typical_controls: Validated reprocessing instructions per AAMI TIR30/ST91
Device design to facilitate cleaning (no blind holes, removable parts)
Compatibility testing with cleaning agents and sterilization methods
Single-use designation (if device cannot be adequately reprocessed)
Instructions for disassembly and inspection
Warnings about prion risk for neurosurgical instruments

hazards.description: Fracture or separation of surgical instrument during use
hazards.harm: Retained foreign body, reoperation for retrieval, tissue injury
typical_controls: Fatigue testing per ASTM standards (device-specific)
Material specifications (surgical stainless steel per ASTM F899)
Instructions for inspection before use (cracks, deformation)
Defined useful life or reprocessing cycle limit
Warnings about excessive force
Post-market surveillance for fracture events

hazards.description: Surgical staples or clips fail to form properly, causing inadequate closure
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Functional failure - Incorrect output
typical_controls: Staple formation testing across tissue thickness range
Tissue thickness gauges in surgical kit
Instructions for proper firing technique and tissue alignment
Visual/tactile feedback for complete firing
Warnings about tissue thickness limits
Clinical leak rate monitoring (target <5% for GI anastomoses)

hazards.description: Air or CO2 enters vasculature during insufflation or laparoscopic surgery
common_causes: Veress needle or trocar directly enters vessel
typical_controls: Pressure limiting in insufflator (max 15-20 mmHg for adults)
Flow rate limiting during initial insufflation
Instructions for entry technique and pressure monitoring
Warnings about vascular injury risk
Use of CO2 (more soluble than air) instead of room air
Clinical monitoring protocols (end-tidal CO2, hemodynamics)

hazards.description: Endoscope lens fogging obscures surgical field visualization
hazards.harm: Increased procedure time, potential for injury from poor visualization
common_causes: Temperature differential between scope and body cavity
Lens contamination with blood or tissue
typical_controls: Anti-fog coating on lens
Instructions for pre-warming scope or anti-fog solution use
Lens cleaning sheaths or wipes in surgical kit
Instructions for removal and cleaning if fogging occurs

hazards.description: Fascial defect at trocar site allows bowel herniation postoperatively
typical_controls: Instructions for fascial closure for ports ≥10mm
Trocar designs that facilitate closure (bladeless, radially expanding)
Sizing options to use smallest effective diameter
Warnings about hernia risk
Clinical surveillance for port site hernias

severity_scale.1: Negligible - No injury or health effect
severity_scale.2: Minor - Temporary injury requiring first aid
severity_scale.4: Critical - Permanent impairment or life-threatening injury
severity_scale.5: Catastrophic - Death or irreversible severe injury
